title: Drawing, "Designs for Souvenir Fans for the 1867 Paris Exposition Universelle", 1866–67
medium: Transparent and some opaque watercolor, white gouache on off-white wove paper
inscribed:
Upper left, graphite: No 10 (crossed out)
Lower left, graphite: No 33, 2-3 et 4 piece
Upper center, graphite: pour trois medallions- distance des medallions (distance marked ~9 cm), à partir de millieu de la gorge 
Lower center, graphite: distance de la gorge (distance marked 3.8 cm), pour la auteur de medallion
At right, graphite: No 34, 2-3 et 5 piece, 58 (under oval)
description:
At left: snowy winter scene, thatched roof house with a chimney spewing smoke, children playing on frozen lake, bare trees, gray sky, two horses pulling a wagon; corners are cut
At right: view of Sorrento at night with Mt. Vesuvius erupting, oval shape; city at left, mid-ground, flame-red eruption on mountain, moon to right, sailboats in gorge, 2 men on shore

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Designs for Souvenir Fans for the 1867 Paris Exposition Universelle", 1866–67.Transparent and some opaque watercolor, white gouache on off-white wove paper. Gift of M. Roy Fisher. 1976-105-11.
